text: Brian Edward Cox OBE FRS (born 3 March 1968) is a British particle physicist. He is also a professor at the University of Manchester and a Royal Society University Research Fellow. He works on the ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). Cox presents some BBC science television programmes the most notable being Stargazing Live and Wonders of Universe. He also presented some episodes of Horizon. ==Early life== Cox was born in 1968 in Chadderton, Oldham, Lancashire. Human Universe â€“ 4. A Place in Space and Time His parents worked for Yorkshire Bank, his mother as a cashier and his father as a middle- manager in the same branch. He was a keyboard player for pop band D:Ream in the 1990s. ==References== ==Other websites== * * *Personal website Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:English pop musicians Category:English physicists Category:Musicians from Lancashire Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire Category:Academics of the University of Manchester
title: Brian Cox (physicist)
